definitions: in a way that shows a deliberate and obstinate desire to behave in an unreasonable or unacceptable manner

examples.text: the group perversely refused to tour until well past their peak
the minister had acted perversely in failing to publish the report

shortDefinitions: in way that shows deliberate and obstinate desire to behave in unreasonable manner

definitions: in a manner contrary to what is expected or accepted

examples.text: he was perversely proud of his parochial background
perhaps perversely, it was his niceness that turned some people against him

shortDefinitions: in manner contrary to what is expected or accepted
